meanings.meaning_en_US: To test something or to audition for a role or position.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 測試某物或對角色或位置進行試鏡

examples.sentence: I want to try out this new recipe for dinner.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想試試這個新食譜來做晚餐。

examples.sentence: She tried out for the school play.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她參加了學校的戲劇試鏡。

examples.sentence: They are trying out several new methods.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們正在嘗試幾種新方法。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To pay attention to or listen to a broadcast.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 注意或收聽廣播

examples.sentence: Make sure to tune in to the live show tonight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保今晚收看現場直播。

examples.sentence: She tunes in to her favorite podcast every week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她每週收聽她最喜歡的播客。

examples.sentence: They tuned in early to catch the beginning of the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們提前收聽以收看活動的開始。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To submit something, such as a report or homework, to an authority or the proper place.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 向當局或適當地方提交某物，例如報告或作業。

examples.sentence: I need to [turn in] my assignment by Friday.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要在星期五之前提交我的作業。

examples.sentence: She [turned in] her resignation yesterday.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她昨天提交了辭職信。

examples.sentence: He forgot to [turn in] his application on time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他忘了按時提交申請。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To activate a device or system.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 啟動設備或系統。

examples.sentence: Please [turn on] the lights when you enter the room.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當你進入房間時，請開燈。

examples.sentence: He [turned on] the television to watch the news.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他打開電視看新聞。

examples.sentence: You need to [turn on] the computer before using it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 使用之前你需要開啟電腦。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To serve or assist someone, especially in a restaurant or similar setting.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 為某人服務或協助，特別是在餐廳或類似環境中。

examples.sentence: The waiter [waited on] us promptly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 服務生及時為我們服務。

examples.sentence: She has experience [waiting on] customers.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她有為客戶服務的經驗。

examples.sentence: I prefer to [wait on] people rather than be waited on.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我更喜歡為他人服務，而不是被服務。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stay awake or continue to wait for someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保持清醒或繼續等待某人。

examples.sentence: I will [wait up] for you to come home.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我會等你回家。

examples.sentence: Don't [wait up] too late; you need to sleep.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要等得太晚；你需要睡覺。

examples.sentence: She usually [waits up] for her children after school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她通常在放學後等她的孩子。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stop sleeping; to become alert or aware.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 停止睡覺；變得警覺或意識到。

examples.sentence: I usually [wake up] at 7 AM.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我通常在早上7點醒來。

examples.sentence: Please [wake up] and get ready for school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請醒來並準備上學。

examples.sentence: He [woke up] suddenly from a loud noise.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他從一聲巨響中驟然醒來。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To enter a place by walking.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過走路進入一個地方。

examples.sentence: You can [walk in] anytime during the day.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以在白天的任何時候進來。

examples.sentence: She [walked in] without knocking.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她沒有敲門就進來了。

examples.sentence: They [walk in] unannounced to surprise us.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們毫無預警地進來給我們驚喜。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To approach someone or something by walking.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過走路接近某人或某事。

examples.sentence: I will [walk up] to her and introduce myself.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我會走上前去介紹自己。

examples.sentence: He [walked up] to me with a smile.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他微笑著走向我。

examples.sentence: They often [walk up] the hill together.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們經常一起爬那座山。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To clean oneself or one's hands and face.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 清洗自己或清洗手和臉。

examples.sentence: Make sure to [wash up] before dinner.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保在晚餐之前洗手。

examples.sentence: He always [washes up] after working in the garden.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在花園工作後總是會洗手。

examples.sentence: Please [wash up] before you eat.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請在吃飯前先洗手。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To prepare a meal quickly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 迅速準備一頓餐。

examples.sentence: I can [whip up] dinner in 30 minutes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我能在30分鐘內準備好晚餐。

examples.sentence: She [whipped up] some pancakes for breakfast.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她迅速為早餐做了些鬆餅。

examples.sentence: He loves to [whip up] desserts for his friends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他喜歡為朋友們快速做甜點。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To conclude or finish something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 結束或完結某事。

examples.sentence: We need to [wind up] this meeting soon.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要快點結束這次會議。

examples.sentence: They [wound up] the event with a speech.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們通過一次演講結束了這個活動。

examples.sentence: Let's [wind up] this project by next week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們在下星期前結束這個項目。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To clean a surface by rubbing it with a cloth or paper.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過用布或紙擦拭來清潔表面。

examples.sentence: Please [wipe up] the spills on the table.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請擦拭桌子上的溢出物。

examples.sentence: He [wiped up] the crumbs after breakfast.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在早餐後清理了麵包屑。

examples.sentence: You should [wipe up] any spills immediately.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該馬上擦拭任何溢出物。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To focus attention on a task or project.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 專注於某個任務或項目。

examples.sentence: I need to [work on] my presentation for tomorrow.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要為明天的報告而努力。

examples.sentence: She is [working on] a new project at work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她正在為工作上的一個新項目而努力。

examples.sentence: We should [work on] our communication skills.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們應該改善我們的溝通技巧。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To complete or finish something, often in a satisfactory manner.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以令人滿意的方式完成或結束某事。

examples.sentence: We need to [wrap up] our discussion by 5 PM.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要在下午5點之前結束討論。

examples.sentence: She [wrapped up] the report before the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在截止日期之前完成了報告。

examples.sentence: Let's [wrap up] this meeting with final thoughts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們以最後的想法結束這次會議。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A phrase used to indicate permission or ability.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 表示許可或能力的短語。

examples.sentence: [You can] finish your homework before dinner.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以在晚餐前完成作業。

examples.sentence: [You can] ask for help if you need it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你需要，可以尋求幫助。

examples.sentence: [You can] join us for the movie tonight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以今晚加入我們看電影。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A colloquial expression used to advise someone to be quiet.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用來建議某人保持安靜的口語表達。

examples.sentence: When the teacher entered, I told him to [zip it]!
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當老師進來時，我告訴他保持安靜！

examples.sentence: You need to [zip it] during the movie.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你在電影期間需要保持安靜。

examples.sentence: She told him to [zip it] when he wouldn't stop complaining.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他不停抱怨時，她告訴他安靜。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To concentrate one's attention on something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 專注於某事。

examples.sentence: I need to [zone in] on my studies this week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這週我需要集中精力學習。

examples.sentence: She [zoned in] on the task at hand.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她專注於手頭的任務。

examples.sentence: You have to [zone in] if you want to succeed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想成功，你必須專注。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To focus closely or magnify an image or details.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 聚焦或放大一個圖像或細節。

examples.sentence: You can [zoom in] on the picture to see more details.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以放大圖片以查看更多細節。

examples.sentence: He [zoomed in] on the important parts of the document.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他放大了文件的重要部分。

examples.sentence: Make sure to [zoom in] for a better view.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保放大以獲得更好的視野。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A phrase indicating that someone is listening attentively.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 表示某人專心聆聽的短語。

examples.sentence: [All ears], I waited for her to start speaking.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我專心等待她開始說話。

examples.sentence: He said he was [all ears] for my story.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他說他在專心聽我的故事。

examples.sentence: They were [all ears] when I mentioned the surprise.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我提及驚喜時，他們都專心聽著。
